comments: Professor Ward was the best English teacher I ever had, his class was so fun, and he made it really easy to learn the material. There is a lot of in class group work, but nothing hard. There are quite a few readings, but theyre short and you have quizzes over them. You write four essays through the course, but have plenty of time to complete them.

comments: Prof. Ward seems to be a little shy. He does not talk much, but when he does it makes sense. What I didn\'t like was that there was not much guidance when it came to what was expected from the essays. Does not follow the new MLA format. There is a lot of group work, which is every class. He is a very fair grader and up to date on pop culture.

comments: Mr Ward is the kindest professor i have had thus far. He is very helpful and gives very good feedback when it comes to essays. There was a total of 4 essays and there is homework such as online discussions. But the reading he chooses for it is interesting and makes you want to do the work!

comments: Prof. Ward is a pretty cool teacher; he likes to strike up random convos with the students. Though there are about 5 essays, only 3 are formal, and he\'s a pretty lax grader. There Is A LOT of reading, but thankfully all your assignments are group work so it\'s easy to get it done. Also, he is very liberal, so if your conservative beware.

comments: I was not looking forward to another English class but I LOVED his class. I loved the topics he chose and I loved the discussions we did. He gave feedback after every discussion to show what to do better on the next one. The papers are long but that is to be expected with any English class.

comments: Online class. Easy class if you keep up with the reading and give yourself enough time to prepare for the essays. I consider myself a good writer, not great, but received high marks on my essays. Professor Ward was kind and helpful in choosing topics for essays. Responded to emails in a timely manner.

comments: Best professor ever! He works hard to get to know his students all individually and he\'s up to date with pop-culture, so talking to him is a blast. He made me feel at home and like he really valued my opinion and what I had to write about.

comments: Professor Ward was the first professor I have had in college. He is kind of shy, but knows how to do his job and do it well. He likes group projects, so if you\'re not one for group projects, I suggest you find another professor. He also has very good feedback on how to improve your essays. He was absolutely my favorite professor.

comments: Amazing professor! He is very thorough when grading your essays, but if you pay attention to what he finds wrong and use that knowledge for your next paper you should get a better grade. All you have to do is TRY. Essays are the biggest part of your grade so as long as you do everything you are suppose to the grade you get is on you, not him.

comments: Professor Ward is very intelligent and he\'s always there to answer any questions! Took this class online and he does have a good amount of discussion boards. alot of reading required for the discussion boards. Final exam isn\'t hard, and neither are the quizzes. We took about 2 quizzes in the whole semester.

comments: Ward is a very intelligent professor. While yes, a tad shy - getting to know him makes all the difference as he appreciates those who spark an interest in him. He assigns about 3 essays and most assignments are group-orientated so if you are wary of that fact, be sure to lead the group work yourself to ensure a better grade. A favorite Professor!!

comments: Shy as an instructor, but very knowledgeable and passionate about his subject. Notes given on graded essays are useful and thorough. Understanding and friendly, as a person. You DO need access to the assigned readings, but that doesn\'t necessarily mean you need the books. Readings come from a wide variety of sources. Very group-oriented class.

comments: I loved Mr. Ward! Very laid back. There is a lot of in class assignments that are very easy. Most in class assignments are group work. The plus is we only did 4 formal essays fall semester. I am taking him next semester for 1302 for sure!!

comments: Awful I have dropped this teacher out of pure dislike for his teaching strategy and his assignments. Every day is a group assignment, so you\'re grade is dependent on other people. And none of his material has anything to do with English. I tried asking how to better my grade and he said "Be more excellent". Un-helpful and extremely disappointing.

comments: Professor Ward always responds to your emails when you need help. He assigns lengthy essays, but gives you great topics to choose from. I wouldn\'t expect anything less from a college writing class. Overall, he is an excellent professor, and I\'m happy that he was my professor.

comments: I really like this guy. Likes Dream Theater, great taste in music. His group assignments, while plentiful, are usually pretty interesting. MBTI- wise iNuitives will enjoy his class, Sensors will find him frustrating. He grades based of your strengths and goes easy on your weaknesses. My advice is to get to know the guy, it makes all the difference.

comments: I have mixed feelings about Mr. Ward\'s class. On one hand, I think he\'s very nice and willing to help you out if you seek out the help. On the other hand, the way his class is structured doesn\'t help you prepare for the midterm and paper. Literally every single day is spent doing group assignments that get graded last-minute.

comments: DO NOT TAKE THIS PROF! Homework assignments are to read 50+ pages, and in class you work as a group (that he assigns) to complete an assignment over what you read. He spends the last 5-10 minutes of class going over the assignment. If you got it wrong, or didn\'t understand the book, you\'re screwed. His quizzes are ridiculous! Papers are 6-7 pages.

comments: Although the class required a sufficient amount of work, it was not hard. If you are looking for a professor to baby you, and aid you in every writing need, do not take him. He can be harsh, and will not always give help. Almost all the assignments are group work, so unless you have a good one, be prepared to do all the work alone, or fail.
